dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, did you catch the news about Jeff Bezos and his recent India trip? Quite a whirlwind, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, did you catch the news about Jeff Bezos and his recent India trip? Quite a whirlwind, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely! The whole $10 billion export pledge for Made In India goods by 2025. That was, uh, quite a statement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely! The whole ten billion dollar export pledge for Made In India goods by twenty twenty five. That was, uh, quite a statement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He also pledged that his company will export $10 billion worth of Made In India goods by 2025.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, a massive number, for sure. I mean, it apparently got a huge round of applause at their Amazon Smbhav event.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, a massive number, for sure. I mean, it apparently got a huge round of applause at their Amazon Smbhav event.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The newswhich was announced during Amazon Smbhav, a two-day summit aimed at bringing business owners together to hear speeches from Amazon representatives and other major executiveswas met with applause.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It did. But, like, you can't ignore the elephant in the room here, can you? It's not all sunshine and applause for Amazon in India.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It did. But, like, you can't ignore the elephant in the room here, can you? It's not all sunshine and applause for Amazon in India.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] You mean the antitrust probe? Because, um, India's watchdog is really looking into Amazon and Flipkart for, you know, predatory pricing and preferential listing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You mean the antitrust probe? Because, um, India's watchdog is really looking into Amazon and Flipkart for, you know, predatory pricing and preferential listing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Indias antitrust watchdog just launched a probe into Amazon and Flipkart for predatory pricing and preferential listing toward its favored brands.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And the Indian government, they've been tightening e-commerce regulations, too, trying to protect their domestic businesses. It's not been an easy ride for Amazon.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And the Indian government, they've been tightening e-commerce regulations, too, trying to protect their domestic businesses. It's not been an easy ride for Amazon.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Indian government has also spent the last year tightening its e-commerce regulations toward foreign online retailers, including rules to stop heavy discounting, in a bid to protect domestic competitors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, not at all. And let's not forget the protests! Millions of small business owners, I mean, across 300 cities, protesting against Amazon during his visit. That's, uh, quite a welcome committee.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, not at all. And let's not forget the protests! Millions of small business owners, I mean, across three hundred cities, protesting against Amazon during his visit. That's, uh, quite a welcome committee.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Further, a trade organization representing millions of small and medium-sized business owners organized protests in 300 cities across the country against Amazon to coincide with the billionaires visit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it really paints a picture, doesn't it? So, Bezos, uh, his response was pretty interesting. All the soft diplomacy, the social media posts...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it really paints a picture, doesn't it? So, Bezos, uh, his response was pretty interesting. All the soft diplomacy, the social media posts...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the flying kites with teenagers! And paying respects at the Gandhi memorial. Very, um, strategic, I'd say.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, the flying kites with teenagers! And paying respects at the Gandhi memorial. Very, um, strategic, I'd say.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He has posted videos on social media of himself paying respects at the Raj Ghat, a memorial dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi in New Delhi, and flying kites with teenagers while in India.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely strategic. And that speech ending, "The 21st century is going to be the Indian century," and then, "the most important alliance is between India and the United States." That's, like, a bold statement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely strategic. And that speech ending, The twenty first century is going to be the Indian century, and then, the most important alliance is between India and the United States. That's, like, a bold statement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a video posted to Instagram, Bezos ended his Amazon Shbhav speech with two declarations regarding India: I predict that the 21st century is going to be the Indian century. In this 21st century, the most important alliance is going to be the alliance between India and the United Statesthe worlds oldest democracy and the worlds largest democracy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Super bold. He's really trying to butter them up, especially with Prime Minister Modi wanting to hit that $5 trillion economy mark by 2024.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Super bold. He's really trying to butter them up, especially with Prime Minister Modi wanting to hit that five trillion dollar economy mark by twenty twenty four.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Prime Minister Modi, who is in his second term in office and faces heavy criticism for encouraging discrimination and violence against Muslims living in India, declared in November that he aims to make India a $5 trillion economy by 2024.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh. And given Modi's facing, you know, quite a bit of criticism himself lately, I think that kind of goodwill from Bezos, the richest man in the world, is probably welcome.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh. And given Modi's facing, you know, quite a bit of criticism himself lately, I think that kind of goodwill from Bezos, the richest man in the world, is probably welcome.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bezos, the richest man in the world, has not made any announcements about meeting with Prime Minister Narenda Modi. ... Prime Minister Modi, who is in his second term in office and faces heavy criticism for encouraging discrimination and violence against Muslims living in India, declared in November that he aims to make India a $5 trillion economy by 2024.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a very delicate dance for Bezos. On one hand, you have all this regulatory pressure and local opposition, and on the other, this massive, um, market potential.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a very delicate dance for Bezos. On one hand, you have all this regulatory pressure and local opposition, and on the other, this massive, um, market potential.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It's a high-stakes game for Amazon in one of the world's fastest-growing economies. He really needs India to be on his side.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It's a high-stakes game for Amazon in one of the world's fastest-growing economies. He really needs India to be on his side.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It's fascinating to watch how these global tech giants navigate such complex political and economic landscapes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It's fascinating to watch how these global tech giants navigate such complex political and economic landscapes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. A lot more than just selling products involved here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. A lot more than just selling products involved here.
